vehicles.description: A large green truck partially obstructs the right-hand lane of the road, with its rear facing our vehicle. Judging by its unique color and shape, the truck seems to be a sanitation vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: This truck may reduce the width of the drivable roadway and may stop or turn suddenly, thus affecting the flow of traffic.

vehicles.description: A white car is driving on the left lane in front of itself, heading in the same direction.
vehicles.explanation: The speed and trajectory of the white car may affect the ability of self-driving vehicles to change lanes or adjust their speed.

barriers.description: There are traffic barriers set up on the right side of the road, marking the edge of the vehicle lane and the pedestrian area.
barriers.explanation: These obstacles delineate the boundaries of the driving space and restrict vehicles from entering non-driving areas.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image, there is a large green truck, likely a sanitation vehicle, partially obstructing the right-hand lane with its rear facing our vehicle. This truck may reduce the roadway's width and could stop or turn suddenly, impacting the flow of traffic. Additionally, a white car is driving on the left lane ahead, moving in the same direction, which could influence the lane-changing and speed-adjusting behavior of self-driving vehicles. Moreover, traffic barriers are present on the right side of the road, marking the boundary between the vehicle lane and the pedestrian area. These barriers help delineate the driving space, preventing vehicles from entering non-driving areas.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the truck; be prepared to slow down if it stops. Observe the behavior of the white car, anticipating its potential lane changes or deceleration to avoid affecting your vehicle. If necessary and safe, consider changing lanes to the left to overtake the truck that is obstructing the flow of traffic. Always ensure to use the turn signal and check the blind spot before changing lanes. It is recommended to continuously monitor the surrounding environment to timely respond to other road users and maintain safety.
